properties.Name: Meaning of colors
properties.description:
Update 2: We removed the color grey (250+ cases), since the map is better represented in 4 colors only.
Update: The color black will be changed to represent cities with 1000+ cases, previously it meant cities with deaths but we are changing it to better reflect the number of cases in each city.
With this, cities with less than 20 cases and one death won't be on the same level as cities with 1,000+ cases and dozens of deaths.

Black: Cities with 1000 or more cases
Purple: Cities with 100 or more cases.
Red: Cities with 20 or more cases.
Orange: Less than 20 cases.

We are leaving here the meaning of the colors since it's hard to access the map description on mobile.
Pd: Special thanks to /r/China_Flu

properties.Name: [THA - 21 / 1] Bangkok - Nonthaburi, Bangkok Metropolitan Region

Jan. 13: First confirmed case of Wuhan resident visiting Bangkok since Jan. 8th.
Jan. 17: Second confirmed case at airport, person arrived from Wuhan. Transferred to Nonthaburi.
Jan. 19: Third confirmed case at airport. (Imported - transferred to Nonthaburi)
Jan. 24: One more case, wife of 4th case. Might have been locally transmitted, waiting for more info.
Jan. 26: Two more cases.
Jan. 28: 6 new cases of Chinese nationals, being treated in Nonthaburi.
Jan. 31: 1 new case. First H2H in Thailand. Joining Bangkok and Nonthaburi due to case transfers.
Feb. 25: Two new cases confirmed. No history of traveling. 
Feb. 26: 3 new cases.
Feb. 28: 1 new case, person who returned from South Korea.
Feb. 29: 1 new case treated in Khan Na Yao. 20 cases total (red).
